page.title: 07Chickney, religion
page.content: The Anglican church of st Mary, Chickney dates from 12th century; now redundant but occasionally used for pilgrimages. In 1972 Chickney was incorporated into the new parish of Broxted with Chickney so the vicar is now responsible for 5 parishes. This has greatly altered the relationship between the vicar and gis parishioners as, however hard working , he can not know them all. This is concomitant with the changing attitudes and values of society whereby the ethos of the village as a united community is no longer germane. Other denominations are; free churches at Thaxted & Broxted, Roman Catholic church at Henham. Population includes a large proportion of Roman Catholics as groups of Belgian refugees came during and after the 1914/18 war. They took up horticulture & chicken farming.
